div.l: The millere / is a pereilous man he seyde
And yf that he out of his sleep a breyde
He myht doon vs bothe / a velonye
Aleyn Answerde I coıı̄unte hym nat a flye
And vp he rist / and bi the wenche he crepte
This wenche lay vpriht / ⁊and slepte
Til he so nyh was / or she myht aspie
That it had be to late / for to crye
And shortly for to sey / they wer atton
Now pley Aleyn / for I wol spek of Iohn
This Iohn lyeth stille / a forlong wey or twoo
And to hym self / maketh routhe ⁊and woo
Allas qduod he / this is a wikked Iape
Now may I say / that I is but an Ape
Yit hath my felawe / somwhat for his harm
He hath the milleris douhtir / in his arm
He aıı̄untred hym / and hath his needis sped
And I ly as a draff / sacch in my bed
And whan this Iape / is told a nothir day
I shal be holde / a daffe a cokenay
I wol a ryse / and auenturen / bi my feyth
Vnhardy vnsely / thus alle men sath saythsath sayth
And vp he ros / and softely forth he wente
Vn to the cradil / and in his hond it hente
And bar it softe / vnto his beddis feet
Soone Aftir the wyf / hir routyng leet
And gan awake / ⁊and wente hir out to pisse
And com agayn / ⁊and gan hir cradil misse
And groped heer ⁊and ther / but she fond noon
Allas qduod she / I hadde almost mys goon
I hadde Almost gon / to the clerkis bed
Ey benedicite / than hadde I euyl sped
And forth she goth / til she the cradil fond
She gropeth alway / ferther with hir hond
And fond the bed / ⁊and thouht nat but good
Bi cause that the cradil / bi it stood
And nyste wher she was / for it was dirk
